description: Creates an archive rule for the specified analyzer. Archive rules automatically archive new findings that meet the criteria you define when you create the rule. To learn about filter keys that you can use to create an archive rule, see IAM Access Analyzer filter keys in the IAM User Guide.

parameters.name: analyzerName
parameters.description: The name of the created analyzer.

parameters.name: ruleName
parameters.description: The name of the rule to create.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The criteria for the rule. (string) --- (dict) --- The criteria to use in the filter that defines the archive rule. For more information on available filter keys, see IAM Access Analyzer filter keys. eq (list) --- An --equals-- operator to match for the filter used to create the rule. (string) --- neq (list) --- A --not equals-- operator to match for the filter used to create the rule. (string) --- contains (list) --- A --contains-- operator to match for the filter used to create the rule. (string) --- exists (boolean) --- An --exists-- operator to match for the filter used to create the rule.

nested_params.name: eq
nested_params.description: An --equals-- operator to match for the filter used to create the rule.

nested_params.name: neq
nested_params.description: A --not equals-- operator to match for the filter used to create the rule.

nested_params.name: contains
nested_params.description: A --contains-- operator to match for the filter used to create the rule.

nested_params.name: exists
nested_params.description: An --exists-- operator to match for the filter used to create the rule.

parameters.name: clientToken
parameters.description: A client token. This field is autopopulated if not provided.
